authors of the manuscript
journal manuscript was published from
the year that the journal was published in
The person that processed this manuscript
whether or not the paper can be included in the meta-analysis (y, n, qual.only)
If exclude = y, then the reason the paper should be excluded
the species of grazer that was used in the study
the relative history of the grazer on the system (i.e. native grazer or domesticated)
Whether the study was comparing gradients or grazed to ungrazed.
If the system has had previous instances of grazing (yes, no).
Length of grazing on the lands if recorded
yes or no if there are measures of plants included in the analysis
latitude of study sites; if more than one separate by semi-colon (;)
longitude of study sites; if more than one separate by semi-colon (;)
elevation of study sites; if more than one separate by semi-colon (;)
country study took place in; if more than one separate by semi-colon (;)
the number of study sites used
the technique for surveying the response taxa (e.g. mark-recapture, pan trap, camera trap, etc)
1/0 if any soil micro-organisms were measured
1/0 if any soil worms were measured
1/0 if any arthropods were measured including insects, centipedes, spiders, scorpions, millipedes, or  springtails
1/0 if any amphibians were measured
1/0 if any reptiles were measured
1/0 if any birds were measured
1/0 if any mammals were measured
Study identifier
any site identifier that was used in the study
any year replicates that were used in the study
any sub-replicate or different treatments that were used within the study
grazed vs ungrazed treatments (includes equivalents)
the measure of grazers used (e.g. number of heads, frequency of grazing)
value that corresponds with the grazing estimate
The response taxa that was surveyed, such as reptilia or aves, can include plants
Genus of response taxa if recorded
Species name of response taxa if recorded
Whether response taxa is native or non-native
the measured estimate of the response taxa (abundance, richness, number of calls, etc)
the statistic used: mean, stdev, sterror. For raw values put "count"
the value of the measured response taxa
